Class BstUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • BstUtils

  • public final class BstUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    BstUtils provides utility methods for students to use, such as toString. The methods here are those that must be correct for the problem coverage tests to run.

    Version:
    20180329
    Author:
    acsiochi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BstUtils()
      This class only supports static methods.

      static java.lang.String toAddress(java.lang.Object o)
      toAddress returns an "address" of the given object.
      static java.lang.String toString(BnodeADT b)
      Generate the canonical toString for the given BstADT.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BstUtils

        public BstUtils()
        This class only supports static methods. Do not instantiate it. Doing so will throw a RuntimeException.

    • Method Detail

      • toAddress

        public static java.lang.String toAddress(java.lang.Object o)
        toAddress returns an "address" of the given object. Note this is not the actual location in memory, but rather a unique identifier. Since it it unique, it is used as a stand-in for a memory address. 
         Given: BstADT x = new BstIMP();
  when: String s = toAddress(x)
  then: s == // something like @20847620
  
 Given: BstADT y = null;
  when: String s = toAddress(y))
  then: s == "null"
        Parameters:
        o - Object whose "address" is desired
        Returns:
        "address" of the given object

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(BnodeADT b)

        Generate the canonical toString for the given BstADT.

        Parameters:
        b - the root of the BstADT whose toString is desired
        Returns:
        toString() of the given BstADT
        See Also:
        BstADT.toString()
